business.headline: Disney-Reliance venture to stream live sports exclusively on Hotstar: ReportWhile Reliance's JioCinema currently streams IPL cricket, Hotstar holds rights to other prestigious events like the International Cricket Council (ICC) tournaments, the English Premier League, and the Pro Kabaddi League.

Ashneer Grover withdraws mismanagement plea against BharatPe from NCLTThe plea alleged mismanagement and oppressive conduct by the fintech company's board. The withdrawal of the plea follows a settlement reached between Grover and BharatPe on September 30, 2024.

India to impose laptop import restrictions to boost local manufacturing: ReportThe planned restrictions, if enforced, could impact the country's IT hardware market, which is currently valued at between $8 billion and $10 billion.
Sensex, Nifty close in green as banking, metal stocks lift marketThe S&P BSE Sensex added 218.14 points to close at, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 104.20 points to end at 24,854.05.

DA hike by 3%: Check new salary, arrear calculations for employees, pensionersThe DA hike increase is effective from July 1, 2024, and was confirmed during a Cabinet meeting chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday.

India's growth rate shines bright in global economy, says Ajay Banga A lot of that growth is in India, is driven by the domestic market as well, which actually is a healthy sign, in some ways, said Ajay Banga, World Bank president.

IGL, MGL shares plunge up to 15% today. Here's why MGL's stock plummeted 11%, reaching a low of Rs 1,568.30, while IGL experienced a 10% drop, closing at Rs 453.70 on the Bombay Stock Exchange as of latest update.

Vistara to operate with 'AI 2' code after merger with Air IndiaVistara, a joint venture between the Tata Group and Singapore Airlines Limited (SIA), is set to formally merge with Air India on November 12, 2024.

Hyundai IPO: GMP signals discounted listing, but can it pull off a surprise?Hyundai IPO listing: Despite the buzz around the automaker's stock market debut, analysts and investors are divided on whether the stock will exceed expectations or struggle, given current market signals.
Explained: Why Infosys shares fell 5% after Q2 results Infosys share price: Infosys reported a profit after tax (PAT) of Rs 6,506 crore for the second quarter (Q2) ending in September 2024.

Wipro shares gain 4% post Q2 results, bonus issue news. Time to buy? The rally came after Wipro announced its second-quarter (Q2) results for the fiscal year 2025 (FY25), posting a 21.3% year-on-year (YoY) jump in net profit to Rs 3,209 crore.
Amazon AWS CEO warns staff: Return to office or resignAmazon AWS CEO Matt Garman defended the decision to implement a five-day in-office work week starting in January 2024.

Explained: Why European Central Bank cut interest rates againECB cuts interest rates: This marks the first time the ECB has implemented back-to-back rate cuts since it began its current cycle of easing in response to falling inflation rates.

RBI action against Navi Finserv, 3 other NBFCs: What it means for customersRBI's regulatory action comes in response to concerns over their loan pricing policies and other regulatory violations, sparking questions about the implications for customers.

Did not run away, will return to India: Byju Raveendran amid insolvency crisisSpeaking during his first virtual press conference in four years, Raveendran refuted rumours that he had fled India to avoid the ongoing insolvency crisis.
Explained: Why Manappuram Finance shares crashed 16% todayAt around 10:30 am shares of Manappuram Finance were down 16.15% to Rs 148.75 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Sensex, Nifty decline in early trade; Manappuram Finance tanks 15%Manappuram Finance Share Price: The S&P BSE Sensex was down 400.17 points to 80,606.44 at 10:12 am, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 96.85 points to trade at 24,653.

Hyundai IPO allotment today: Check status online; GMP shows weak listingHyundai Motor India IPO allotment: Investors can check their allotment status online. They can log in to either the BSE website or the website of Kfin Technologies Limited, the registrar for the issue.
Waaree Energies IPO: 10 things to know before subscribingWaaree Energies Limited (WEL), founded in 1990 and headquartered in Mumbai, is India's leading manufacturer and exporter of solar modules.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Shot in head, arm smashed: What Hamas chief Yahya Sinwar's autopsy showsHamas leader Yahya Sinwar was killed by a gunshot to the head, suffered multiple injuries before his death, and was identified through a DNA test using his severed finger, according to reports.

Rift in Maharashtra Opposition? Congress, Uddhav Sena trade barbs over seat shareShiv Sena (UBT) leader Sanjay Raut criticised the Congress's slow decision-making process. Congress leader Nana Patole, however, said the final decisions on seat-sharing would be made by Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge.

Play Champions Trophy in Pakistan, return home same day: PCB to IndiaThe Pakistan Cricket Board has suggested to its Indian counterpart BCCI that it may opt play Champions Trophy matches in Pakistan and to return to Delhi or Chandigarh on the same day, in case the team does not want to stay back in Pakistan.

Thick smog blankets Delhi as air quality dips to 'very poor'Anand Vihar, Mundka, Dwarka-Sector 8, Rohini Narela and Jahangirpuri are among the 13 hotspots in Delhi where the AQI has risen to over 300 in the last few days.

Here for the comments: How comment culture is changing the way we scroll Instagram ReelsInstagram, a platform initially designed to share photos, has turned into one that brings brands, influencers, and people together, thanks to the 'comment section culture'.

5 flights get bomb threats in 24 hours, one diverted to Frankfurt in emergencyA Vistara flight from Delhi to London was diverted to Frankfurt due to a bomb threat. An Air India Express flight from Dubai conducted searches after landing in Jaipur.

Hamas considering Yahya Sinwar's replacement from outside Gaza: ReportBesides Khalil Al-Hayya, who is Hamas' chief negotiator, the other main leadership contenders are Khaled Meshaal, Haniyeh's predecessor, and Mohammad Darwish, a little-known figure who chairs the Shura Council.

IND vs NZ: 'Crisis man' Sarfaraz Khan hits maiden Test hundred in BengaluruSarfaraz Khan hit his maiden Test hundred on Day 4 of the 1st Test between India and New Zealand in Bengaluru. He led India's charge and took the team out of trouble.

IIT Delhi's Technology & AI Leadership Programme: Shaping the Future of Tech LeadershipAdvance your career with IIT Delhi's Technology & AI Leadership Programme. Designed for aspiring tech leaders, this programme offers cutting-edge insights, practical experience, and strategic acumen to navigate the digital era. Gain the skills to drive innovation, lead digital transformations, and position yourself as a visionary in technology leadership.

Rajasthan: The Royal Canvas for Dream WeddingsWhether it's the grandeur of a palace wedding in Udaipur, the mystique of a desert wedding in Jaisalmer, or the creativity of a themed wedding in Jaipur, Rajasthan offers a wedding experience that is truly out of the ordinary.

'Dravida' skipped in Tamil Nadu state song, MK Stalin seeks Governor's removalTamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin called the omission of 'Dravida' during the singing of the state song an insult to the Tamil language. He also alleged that Governor RN Ravi suffered from "Dravidian allergy".
How extreme rainfall raises risk of death from heart and respiratory diseasesA new study links extreme rainfall with increased mortality, particularly from heart and lung diseases.

Congress wants 3 seats, upset with Samajwadi's offer of 2 for UP bypolls: SourcesUP bypolls: The Samajwadi Party has offered the Ghaziabad and Khair (Aligarh) seats to the Congress, while it has announced its candidate for the Phulpur seat, which the Congress is still staking its claim on.

AAP's Satyendar Jain walks out of jail: 'Fight against injustice to continue'Delhi Chief Minister Atishi, along with AAP leaders Manish Sisodia and Sanjay Singh greeted Jain as he walked out of the jail.

How a Punjabi gangster became a cult figure for immigrant youths in CanadaBindy Johal was the first prominent Indo-Canadian in the mafia world of Canada. The Punjabi gangster's sensational rise, his flashy lifestyle, numerous encounters with women and the shattering of the South-Asian stereotype, have given him a cult status. Killed in 1998, Johal continues to attract youths to Canada's gang world.

Charles Babbage, the man behind the blueprint of today's computersOn the anniversary of his passing, we celebrate Charles Babbage, the brilliant mind whose groundbreaking designs for mechanical computers laid the foundation for the digital age. Though unrecognised during his lifetime, his visionary ideas continue to shape the technology on which we rely today.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Back home from conflict zones, India Today reporters recount risks in war reportingIn this episode of Battle Cry, watch as India Today's reporters Gaurav Sawant and Ashutosh Mishra, who are back home from the war zones in Israel and Lebanon, share their experiences of covering a war.
Iranian newspaper likely to face charges over cartoon mocking internet curbsAn Iranian newspaper, Ham Mihan, compared public patience to the Biblical figure Job is likely to face criminal charges.

East Bengal vs Mohun Bagan, ISL: A battle beyond points returnsThe iconic Kolkata Derby returns on October 19 as struggling East Bengal FC face arch-rivals Mohun Bagan Super Giants. While Mohun Bagan seek to extend their derby dominance, East Bengal hope to break their winless streak in this highly anticipated Indian Super League clash.

Why the Bengal BJP desperately awaits Amit Shah's visitThe home minister's presence at the launch of the membership drive in Kolkata is billed as a morale-booster for workers dejected since their lacklustre show in the Lok Sabha polls.

Ishan Kishan set for national team return with India A's Australia tourIshan Kishan is set to return to the national team fold with India A's tour of Australia. Kishan, who has been playing in the domestic competitions has done well since his return from personal break.

Delhi Metro to introduce additional trips to ease traffic during festive seasonTo combat rising pollution and traffic congestion during the festive season, DMRC will introduce additional metro trips when GRAP stages II or III are enforced.
Former One Direction member Niall Horan's 'heartbreaking' tribute to Liam PayneSinger Niall Horan mourned the death of his former bandmate Liam Payne, sharing heartfelt memories and condolences.

Pics: Orry poses with Ananya Panday, Janhvi Kapoor at friend's pre-weddingSocial media star Orry struck his signature pose with Bollywood celebrities Ananya Panday, Janhvi Kapoor, Sara Ali Khan, and others at his friends, Krisha Parekh and Yash Singhal's pre-wedding bash.

Vettaiyan box office Day 9: Rajinikanth's film enters 2nd weekend on slow noteVettaiyan, starring Rajinikanth and Amitabh Bachchan, finished its first week in the range of Rs 122 crore nett at the domestic box office. The film has now entered its second weekend.

Pics: Priyanka Chopra attends her film Paani's screening with familyPriyanka Chopra Jonas attended the screening of her film Paani with her mother Madhu Chopra and brother Siddharth Chopra. Filmmakers Sooraj Barjatya and Mahesh Manjrekar and the cast and crew of Paani were also present.

sports.headline: Wanindu Hasaranga returns as Sri Lanka announce squad for ODIs vs West IndiesSri Lanka gears up for the ODI series against West Indies with key players returning from injury and fresh faces earning call-ups. With momentum from their 2-1 T20I series win, the hosts aim to maintain their winning run at Pallekele.

Heavily strapped Rishabh Pant braves injury, comes out to bat on Day 4India vs New Zealand: A heavily strapped Rishabh Pant came out to bat on Day 4 of the Bengaluru Test match on Saturday, October 19. Pant had not taken the field on Day 3 after getting hit on the knee with the ball.

Abhishek Nayar wants 'domestic beast' Sarfaraz Khan to score 300 in BengaluruIndia vs New Zealand: India assistant coach Abhishek Nayar wants domestic beast Sarfaraz Khan to translate his form into international cricket and score a triple hundred in the Bengaluru Test. India still trail by 125 runs at the start of Day 4 of the Test match.
Devine feels 'privileged' to play T20 World Cup final after West Indies winSophie Devine felt privileged to have got the chance to play in the final of Women's T20 World Cup 2024.

Chandika Hathurusingha slams BCB over player assault allegationsFormer Bangladesh head coach Chandika Hathurusigha has slammed the Bangladesh Cricket Board over allegations that he physically assaulted a player during the ODI World Cup 2023. Hathurusingha has called the allegations premeditated and has agreed to cooperate fully with any investigation into these matters.

PKL: Ashu Malik Helps Dabang Delhi K.C. Win Against U MumbaDabang Delhi K.C. kicked off their PKL Season 11 campaign with a commanding 36-28 win over U Mumba. Ashu Malik's brilliant all-round performance, including a crucial Super 10, helped his team secure victory on the opening night of the season.

Pawan Sehrawat stars as Telugu Titans beat Bengaluru Bulls in PKL openerPawan Sehrawat starred in the opening match of PKL Season 11, leading the Telugu Titans to a commanding 37-29 victory over the Bengaluru Bulls at Gachibowli Indoor Stadium, showcasing his skills and achieving a historic milestone.

New Zealand survive Dottin scare to book final berth in T20 World CupNZ vs WI, Women's T20 World Cup: New Zealand stormed into the final of the tournament after beating West Indies by 8 runs at the Sharjah Cricket Stadium. Deandra Dottin picked up four wickets and scored 33 runs, but her efforts were not enough for the 2016 champions to stay alive.

Erik ten Hag brushes United sacking rumours: Noise is from outsideErik ten Hag dismissed rumors of his impending sacking, insisting that Manchester United's confidence in him remains intact. Despite a challenging season so far, the Dutch manager is determined to steer the team back to winning ways.

Sarfaraz Khan is a 2024 version of Javed Miandad: Manjrekar IND vs NZ: Sarfaraz Khan drew praise from Sanjay Manjrekar after he scored an unbeaten 70 at Stumps on Day 3 of the opening Test against New Zealand in Bengaluru.

Ranji Trophy: Teenager Ayush Mhatre's ton, bowlers put Mumbai in commandAyush Mhatre's maiden first-class century and Mumbai's strong bowling display helped them dominate Maharashtra on Day 1 of their Ranji Trophy clash. Mhatre's unbeaten 127 guided Mumbai to 220/3 at stumps, taking a commanding 94-run lead.

Mohammad Rizwan likely to replace Babar Azam as Pakistan's ODI and T20I captainMohammad Rizwan is the frontrunner to take over captaincy of white-ball teams. Babar Azam, Shaheen Afridi and Naseem Shah are set to return to the ODI and T20I squad for the tour of Australia.

Ishan Kishan hits century to rescue Jharkhand against Railways Ranji Trophy: Ishan Kishan scored 101 runs off 158 balls and helped Jharkhand score 325 for the loss of five wickets at Stumps on Day 1 against Railways on Friday.

Kuldeep backs Sarfaraz to rescue India with double hundred in Bengaluru TestIndia vs New Zealand: Kuldeep Yadav hoped Sarfaraz Khan, who was batting on 70 at Stumps on Day 3, will score a big hundred and rescue India on Saturday in Bengaluru.

'Great leader': VVS Laxman praises Rohit Sharma for admitting Bengaluru mistakeIndia vs New Zealand: Rohit Sharma continues to earn praise for fronting up to face the press hours after India were bundled out for 46, their lowest Test total at home in Bengaluru.

PCB not willing to move Champions Trophy final out of LahoreThe Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) is mentally prepared for India potentially refusing to travel to Pakistan for the Champions Trophy. However, despite this possibility, the PCB has no intention of moving the tournament's final from Lahore, even if both arch-rivals make it to the title match.

Sai Sudharsan auditions for Australia tour with double hundred in Ranji Trophy Ranji Trophy 2024: Sai Sudharsan hit an unbeaten 202, continuing his purple patch in red-ball cricket. The left-handed opener's double helped Tamil Nadu dominate Delhi at the Arun Jaitley Stadium.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
